alert.note: Alert for Athens; Washington (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 01 at 5:59PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Washington, southeastern Athens, Pleasants, western Tyler and Wood Counties through 630 PM EDT... At 559 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Washington, or near Belpre, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Parkersburg, Marietta, Belpre, St. Marys, Coolville, Vienna, Williamstown, Sistersville, Belmont, Washington, Mineralwells, Lubeck, Boaz, Newport, Matamoras, North Hills, Friendly, Maxwell, Little Hocking and Schultz. This includes the following highways... Interstate 77 in West Virginia between mile markers 167 and 186. Interstate 77 in Ohio between mile markers 1 and 6. Route 50 in West Virginia between mile markers 1 and 23. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Charleston West Virginia.
